subject: Re: [junit] Suite of suites
msgSnippet: JUnit itself can t help you there, as far as I know. Did you check out cpsuite? http://johanneslink.net/projects/cpsuite.jsp Otherwise you could use ant or
messageBody:
JUnit itself can't help you there, as far as I know.

Did you check out cpsuite?
http://johanneslink.net/projects/cpsuite.jsp

Otherwise you could use ant or maven or alike. They can use file
patterns to find tests.
Eclipse can run all tests in a package/directory, but has problems
with suites, such that it executes the tests and the suites, executing
the tests at least twice.

Greetings,
Malte

On 31 January 2011 06:29, marcelo_javier_ruiz
<marcelo_javier_ruiz@...> wrote:
> Hi All!
> I am having a problem with JUnit4.8.2 that I can't solve.
> I have tons of tests in my project.
> In each package I have a suite class called AllTests like the following:
>
> @...({
>        FirstTest.class,
>        SecondTest.class,
>        ThirdTest.class})
> public class AllTests {
>
>    public AllTests() {
>    }
> }
>
> I would like to create a "super" suite class containing all the suites of my project. Can anyone please tell me how to do that?
> Thanks a lot!
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
